  "Broker Comment" : "REGARDING FINAL ACTION ON THIS CASE - THE FEDERAL COURT CASE WAS DISMISSED, HOWEVER, THE STATE CASE IS STILL PENDING WITH THE DISMISSAL IMMINENT VERY SHORTLY.  U-4 AMMENDMENT WILL BE FILED ONCE STATE CASE IS CLOSED. \"THIS LAWSUIT WAS INITIALLY FILED IN MASSACHUSETTS STATE COURT, AND IT WAS REMOVED TO FEDERAL COURT.  AFTER RR'S MOTION TO DISMISS CLAIMS UNDER FEDERAL SECURITIES LAWS WAS ALLOWED AND THOSE CLAIMS WERE DISMISSED WITH PREJUDICE, THE LAWSUIT WAS REMANDED TO MASSACHUSETTS STATE COURT, IN WHICH RR MOVED TO DISMISS THE CLAIMS UNDER STATE LAW.   ALL CLAIMS UNDER MASSACHUSETTS SECURITIES LAWS WERE DISMISSED ALMOST IMMEDIATELY, BUT THE CASE WAS OTHERWISE ALLOWED TO PROCEED.  RR SUBSEQUENTLY MOVED FOR SUMMARY JUDGMENT ON THE REMAINING CLAIMS, ASSERTING GROUNDS SIMILAR TO THOSE ON WHICH HE PREVAILED IN FEDERAL COURT.  ALTHOUGH THAT MOTION WAS DENIED, IT IS THE SUBJECT OF A PENDING INTERLOCUTORY APPEAL, WITH THE MASSACHUSETTS SUPREME JUDICIAL COURT HAVING PREVIOUSLY NOTED THE \"POTENTIAL SIGNIFICANCE OF THE ISSUES\" RAISED BY RR.  TO DATE, 10 OF THE 13 CAUSES OF ACTION - INCLUDING ALL CLAIMS UNDER THE FEDERAL AND MASSACHUSETTS SECURITIES LAWS - HAVE BEEN DISMISSED WITH PREJUDICE, AND THE PENDING APPEAL, IF SUCCESSFUL, WILL RESULT IN DISMISSAL OF THE REMAINING 3 CLAIMS.\""
